text:
Hi! I'm running apache 2.0.54 in SUSE Enterprise 9.
I recieved this error after three or four hours:

child pid 22382 exit signal Segmentation fault (11), possible coredump in /opt

I attach a coredump:

#761 0x752f3d5f in ?? ()
#762 0x6c2f7273 in ?? ()
#763 0x6c61636f in ?? ()
#764 0x6170612f in ?? ()
#765 0x32656863 in ?? ()
#766 0x6e69622f in ?? ()
#767 0x7474682f in ?? ()
#768 0x2f006470 in ?? ()
#769 0x2f727375 in ?? ()
#770 0x61636f6c in ?? ()
#771 0x70612f6c in ?? ()
#772 0x65686361 in ?? ()
#773 0x69622f32 in ?? ()
#774 0x74682f6e in ?? ()
#775 0x00647074 in ?? ()
#776 0x00000000 in ?? ()
Cannot access memory at address 0xc0000000

Anyone know about this error?
creator: martinferna@gmail.com
martinferna@gmail.com

creator: jorton@redhat.com
text:
Thanks for the report.  You can apply this patch:

http://svn.apache.org/viewcvs.cgi/httpd/httpd/trunk/modules/ldap/util_ldap_cache_mgr.c?rev=225746&view=diff&r1=225746&r2=225745&p1=httpd/httpd/trunk/modules/ldap/util_ldap_cache_mgr.c&p2=/httpd/httpd/trunk/modules/ldap/util_ldap_cache_mgr.c

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 34209 ***
